html: For my family, #Alzheimers is an issue that hits home. My mother had it. Her mother and her grandmother had it. I know firsthand that Alzheimer’s is a heartbreaking disease—for those afflicted with it, and for those who love them. I also know we in Congress can do more to help.
text:

I also know we in Congress can do more to help.

html: To the American people: Don’t be fooled or distracted by these political games. We cannot allow cynicism to win. We can reduce our nation’s carbon footprint, strengthen our economy and support those most vulnerable among us.

html: The president’s failed leadership on #climatechange threatens our health, our economy, U.S. competitiveness and our future. And sadly, most of our @SenateGOP friends have been applauding the president with every action.
text: The president’s failed leadership on #climatechange threatens our health, our economy, U.S. competitiveness and our future. And sadly, most of our @SenateGOP friends have been applauding the president with every action.

html: Instead of pursuing any ideas to #ActOnClimate, this administration has: ignored climate science defunded clean energy research rolled back climate action walked away from provisions that would help protect Americans from rising floods and other extreme weather events
text:
Instead of pursuing any ideas to #ActOnClimate, this administration has:
 ignored climate science
 defunded clean energy research
 rolled back climate action
 walked away from provisions that would help protect Americans from rising floods and other extreme weather events

html: Scientists tell us that unchecked climate change means more frequent and intense storms – meaning bomb cyclones, intense rainfalls and category five hurricanes become the new normal. No matter where we live, we can’t ignore the reality of climate change. #ClimateChangeIsReal
text: Scientists tell us that unchecked climate change means more frequent and intense storms – meaning bomb cyclones, intense rainfalls and category five hurricanes become the new normal. No matter where we live, we can’t ignore the reality of climate change. #ClimateChangeIsReal

 In 2017, extreme weather cost Americans $300 billion in economic damages

html: A clear majority of Americans want Congress to address our growing #climatecrisis. We should be having a fact-based, policy-driven conversation about tackling it. And we should be talking about the real costs that confront us – including the costs of inaction.

html: John McCain was, and always will be, a true American hero. He continuously demonstrated his courage and leadership throughout his decades of service to this country. No disparaging comment could ever change that.
text: John McCain was, and always will be, a true American hero. He continuously demonstrated his courage and leadership throughout his decades of service to this country. No disparaging comment could ever change that.

html: While @realDonaldTrump enjoyed five draft deferments, John McCain risked his life for our country, suffered unimaginable brutality in captivity and refused to leave his comrades behind. I know a hero when I see one.
text: While @realDonaldTrump enjoyed five draft deferments, John McCain risked his life for our country, suffered unimaginable brutality in captivity and refused to leave his comrades behind. I know a hero when I see one.

html: My friend John McCain stepped forward and answered our nation's call to serve. And serve us he did, like few others have.

html: Dover Air Force Base is home to some of the nation’s most impressive aircraft fleet. Over the past nine years, C-5M flight crews operating out of Dover and @Travis60AMW have set a total of 89 world records — making the C-5M the world's top aviation record holder.

html: First, @realDonaldTrump said Mexico was going to pay for a wall across our Southern border. Mexico said no. Then he said taxpayers should pay for it. And Congress said no — repeatedly. Now, to get his way, he wants our military to bear the enormous costs.
text:
First, @realDonaldTrump said Mexico was going to pay for a wall across our Southern border. Mexico said no. 

Then he said taxpayers should pay for it. And Congress said no — repeatedly.

Now, to get his way, he wants our military to bear the enormous costs.

html: Both private and public entities should feel a sense of urgency to bolster their cyber defenses. Congress, the Administration, and American businesses need to work together to put in place nationwide cybersecurity standards to protect consumers.
text: Both private and public entities should feel a sense of urgency to bolster their cyber defenses. Congress, the Administration, and American businesses need to work together to put in place nationwide cybersecurity standards to protect consumers.

html: It’s my hope that, by shedding light on @Equifax’s cybersecurity failures that led to this devastating data breach, other U.S. companies can avoid similar breaches that leave millions of American households exposed to hackers.
text: It’s my hope that, by shedding light on @Equifax’s cybersecurity failures that led to this devastating data breach, other U.S. companies can avoid similar breaches that leave millions of American households exposed to hackers.

html: .@Equifax’s two largest competitors – @TransUnion and @Experian – received the same information about potential vulnerabilities, took proper steps to secure their systems and, to date, have avoided a breach.
text: .@Equifax’s two largest competitors – @TransUnion and @Experian – received the same information about potential vulnerabilities, took proper steps to secure their systems and, to date, have avoided a breach.

html: In 2015, @Equifax learned it had thousands of cyber vulnerabilities, but did not address those known security issues. Unsurprisingly, in 2017, @Equifax experienced a massive breach that exposed the sensitive data over 145 million Americans.
text:
In 2015, @Equifax learned it had thousands of cyber vulnerabilities, but did not address those known security issues.
 
Unsurprisingly, in 2017, @Equifax experienced a massive breach that exposed the sensitive data over 145 million Americans.

html: You would think that protecting the sensitive information its entire business relies on would be @Equifax’s top priority. Yet my report with @senrobportman illustrates years-long neglect of basic cybersecurity practices.https://www.carper.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/pressreleases?id=C21B82E3-F715-4D72-AA12-DDB7963B15EB …

html: If someone shops regularly at a retail chain that gets hacked, that person can opt not to shop there any longer if doing so makes them uncomfortable. They cannot, however, keep their information away from @Equifax.
text: If someone shops regularly at a retail chain that gets hacked, that person can opt not to shop there any longer if doing so makes them uncomfortable. They cannot, however, keep their information away from @Equifax.

html: When hackers obtain someone's person information, the consequences are real. The constant stream of data breaches we see year in and year out are a sign to me that we could and should be doing a lot better. That is certainly the case with @Equifax.

html: It’s been a great long weekend in Central America! To end our trip, @SenJeffMerkley, @RepLBR, @DonaldNorcross, @RepDonBeyer, @RepLouCorrea and I flew to El Salvador to meet with government officials and hear from Salvadorans about their hopes and dreams for their vibrant country.
text: It’s been a great long weekend in Central America! To end our trip, @SenJeffMerkley, @RepLBR, @DonaldNorcross, @RepDonBeyer, @RepLouCorrea and I flew to El Salvador to meet with government officials and hear from Salvadorans about their hopes and dreams for their vibrant country.

html: Had a great discussion with the Attorney General of Honduras and other law enforcement leaders in the country on ways to combat illicit trafficking and criminal gangs, reduce corruption and impunity, and strengthen democratic governance and the rule of law in Honduras.pic.twitter.com/scj0WkfeAH
text: Had a great discussion with the Attorney General of Honduras and other law enforcement leaders in the country on ways to combat illicit trafficking and criminal gangs, reduce corruption and impunity, and strengthen democratic governance and the rule of law in Honduras.pic.twitter.com/scj0WkfeAH

html: Met with Honduras’ President Juan Orlando Hernandez who is committed to strengthening the rule of law and creating economic opportunity for all Hondurans. It’s imperative that the United States does its part to help by investing in the Alliance for Prosperity.pic.twitter.com/jQO7DDTRul
text: Met with Honduras’ President Juan Orlando Hernandez who is committed to strengthening the rule of law and creating economic opportunity for all Hondurans. It’s imperative that the United States does its part to help by investing in the Alliance for Prosperity.pic.twitter.com/jQO7DDTRul

html: One of the brightest spots in my trip was having the opportunity to talk with the people of Guatemala and hear their stories. html: Had an informative meeting with Guatemala’s Attorney General Consuela Porras and Special Prosecutor Francisco Sandoval on why it’s so important to the structural integrity of a democracy to support the rule of law. Together, we can and must stand up to fight against corruption.
text: Had an informative meeting with Guatemala’s Attorney General Consuela Porras and Special Prosecutor Francisco Sandoval on why it’s so important to the structural integrity of a democracy to support the rule of law. Together, we can and must stand up to fight against corruption.

html: We pressed President Morales to recommit to fostering economic growth; investing in education and workforce development; upholding the rule of law; and rebuilding citizens’ trust in the government by increasing transparency.

html: The good news? We know what works. We need to tackle the root causes of migration from Central American countries, not merely the symptoms at our border. We must address the violence and humanitarian crisis in the Northern Triangle forcing families to seek refuge in the U.S.
text: The good news? We know what works. We need to tackle the root causes of migration from Central American countries, not merely the symptoms at our border. We must address the violence and humanitarian crisis in the Northern Triangle forcing families to seek refuge in the U.S.

html: Just yesterday, President Trump declared a national emergency for his manufactured crisis at the U.S. Southern border. But if President Trump wants to actually get serious about addressing migration, then we need long-term and comprehensive solutions.
text: Just yesterday, President Trump declared a national emergency for his manufactured crisis at the U.S. Southern border. But if President Trump wants to actually get serious about addressing migration, then we need long-term and comprehensive solutions.

html: At a time when immigration and border security talks are heightened, it’s important to learn more about the places that the migrants arriving at our U.S. Southern border are coming from. And that’s what we’re here to do.
text: At a time when immigration and border security talks are heightened, it’s important to learn more about the places that the migrants arriving at our U.S. Southern border are coming from. And that’s what we’re here to do.

html: Unfortunately, many Guatemalans seek to flee their homes and make the dangerous journey to the U.S. due to violence, poverty, and lack of rule of law in their country.
text: Unfortunately, many Guatemalans seek to flee their homes and make the dangerous journey to the U.S. due to violence, poverty, and lack of rule of law in their country.

html: I’m proud to co-sponsor the #FirstStepAct, which enacts long overdue prison reforms by: Reducing federal mandatory minimum penalties Ending federal juvenile solitary confinement Redirecting funding for urgent law enforcement efforts Expanding opioid abuse treatments
text:
I’m proud to co-sponsor the #FirstStepAct, which enacts long overdue prison reforms by:
 Reducing federal mandatory minimum penalties
 Ending federal juvenile solitary confinement
 Redirecting funding for urgent law enforcement efforts
 Expanding opioid abuse treatments

html: We should not be aiming to win any records for how many individuals we are incarcerating. Rather, we should be working to ensure that those who serve their time are re-entering our society as better people – not better criminals. #FirstStepActpic.twitter.com/iat1Sb0Hsp
text: We should not be aiming to win any records for how many individuals we are incarcerating. Rather, we should be working to ensure that those who serve their time are re-entering our society as better people – not better criminals. #FirstStepActpic.twitter.com/iat1Sb0Hsp

html: The U.S. makes up only 5% of the world’s population, but incarcerates more than 20% of its prisoners. And despite the $80 billion we spend annually, our criminal justice system continues to face problems with overcrowding, inmate violence and high recidivism rates
text:
The U.S. makes up only 5% of the world’s population, but incarcerates more than 20% of its prisoners.
 
And despite the $80 billion we spend annually, our criminal justice system continues to face problems with overcrowding, inmate violence and high recidivism rates

html: For five whole days in 1787, Delaware made up the whole United States! Our state sure knew a good idea when we saw it. There’s good reason why the U.S. Constitution is the most replicated constitution in the history of the world.
text: For five whole days in 1787, Delaware made up the whole United States! Our state sure knew a good idea when we saw it. There’s good reason why the U.S. Constitution is the most replicated constitution in the history of the world.

html: Happy #DelawareDay! 231 years ago today, the history of our country was changed forever when Delaware became the first state to ratify the United States Constitution – providing the very foundation for our democracy that has been emulated the world over.pic.twitter.com/YTluIFxkc1
text:
Happy #DelawareDay!
 
231 years ago today, the history of our country was changed forever when Delaware became the first state to ratify the United States Constitution – providing the very foundation for our democracy that has been emulated the world over.pic.twitter.com/YTluIFxkc1

html: But, above all, he was a good man who treated others with kindness and respect. He knew we could disagree without being disagreeable. We could all learn a great deal from the example he set.

html: George H.W. Bush was a public servant who dedicated his life to our country — as a decorated Navy pilot, as a congressman, as a diplomat, as CIA Director, as Vice President and as our President. He believed in our institutions and exemplified what it means to be a true leader.

We will not only be judged by voters this November; we will be judged by history. Let’s show that we are willing to take a stand to do the right thing.

html: As Governor of Delaware, I nominated dozens of men and women to serve as judges. What I looked for the most was truthfulness and judicial temperament. What we saw last week was not acceptable for a judge on the Delaware Court of Common Pleas, let alone our nation's highest court.

 Dr. Ford wasn’t interviewed. 
 Dozens of people who know Dr. Ford, Ms. Ramirez and Brett Kavanaugh weren’t interviewed.

It is clear this process was never designed to inform.

html: On Monday, we learned that a Russian national was trying to advance Russian interests through the NRA. html: We have laws in this country for a reason. The Hatch Act ensures government officials don’t use their positions to unfairly influence political activity, like elections. html: The American people spoke. The Senate spoke. Now it’s the House’s turn to raise their voice. All Americans – not just those who can afford to pay more – should have access to a free and open internet in this day and age. We must restore #NetNeutrality
text:
The American people spoke.
 
The Senate spoke.
 
Now it’s the House’s turn to raise their voice. 
 
All Americans – not just those who can afford to pay more – should have access to a free and open internet in this day and age. We must restore #NetNeutrality
